resources.string: Hide Bar is an android service that can hide or show the systembar.
This will put a menu in the notification area, from where the systembar can be hidden.
This will automatically hide the systembar at boot.
Choose the method for showing the systembar when it is hidden.

Once you hide the systembar it will not be possible to show the systembar again, unless you disable the service in this preference screen. So be very careful with this option. It should only be used when you really want your tablet in kiosk mode.
There will be an invisible back button at the lower-left corner of the screen.

Use the icon with two downward arrows in the systembar to open a notification. Then click on that notification to hide the systembar. To show the systembar again, touch the bottom of the screen. \nThere is also a widgit available to hide or show the systembar.

Description: Hide Bar can be used to toggle the android systembar on and off.

It seems that this device is not rooted or busybox is not configured correctly.

 HideBar cannot work correctly on a non rooted device. To hide the systembar, this application has to use low level functionality of android. This can only be done on a rooted device.

 BusyBox is needed on some devices. If you get this message, install busybox and start busybox at least once. Installing busybox alone is not enough, it must be run also.

 If your device is rooted and HideBar does not work as expected, contact the developer (Pieter Pareit, pieter.pareit@gmail.com).
